Package demoworld.scholar

Class Scholar

Object
Scholar
public class Scholar extends Object
This class is responsible for loading in a given character sheet file and processing it. Example Use: 
 
 Scholar scholar = new Scholar(rulebook);
 Character character = scholar.build("./demo.sheet").getCharacter();

  • Nested Class Summary

    Nested Classes
    Modifier and Type
    Class
    Description
    static enum 
    Scholar.Mode
    An enum for tracking the current processing mode of the program (NONE, SPECIALTIES, FEATURES).

    • build

      public Scholar build(String filePath)
      Takes the file at the given filepath, reads the text line by line, and processes it.
      Parameters:
      filePath - the filepath to be read and processed
      Returns:
      a reference to the Scholar instance, allowing method chaining

    • getCurrentMode

      public Scholar.Mode getCurrentMode()
      Returns the current Scholar.Mode scholar is configured to.
      Returns:
      the current Scholar.Mode scholar is configured to

    • processLine

      public void processLine(String line)
      Processes a given line of text determining if there is any information within that should be tracked for future use if/when getCharacter is called. [v1.2 - clarified] If currentMode is NONE, extracts name, force, quickness, resilience, analytical, empathy, hitpoints, temporary hitpoints, or experience statistics. If "SPECIALTIES" is present, sets the currentMode to SPECIALTIES. If "FEATURES" is present, sets the currentMode to FEATURES. If currentMode is SPECIALTIES, extracts the Specialty or Specialties. If currentMode is FEATURES, extracts the Features.
      Parameters:
      line - The line that will be processed.

    • getCharacter

      public Character getCharacter()
      Generates a new Character using the information stored in scholar from it reading the given file and consulting the RuleBook where relevant.
      Returns:
      The new Character

    • extractCurrentHp

      public int extractCurrentHp(String line)
      Extracts the current HP (hit points) from the given line of text.
      Parameters:
      line - the line of text containing the HP information
      Returns:
      the extracted current HP as an int
